simzombie.engine.environment
Class Environment

java.lang.Object
  simzombie.engine.environment.Environment
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Environment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Handles the environment of the simulation, including which agents are present in particular cells. The Environment class also manages whether agents are 'able' to move from one cell to another, which is established using the edges of the simulation and the walls of the given cells.

Since:
2011-10-28
See Also:

setCellsWide

public void setCellsWide(int cellsWide)
Adjusts the number of cell columns in the environment. All cells are deleted by this method and then recreated to the new specification. This loses agent data, and should ONLY be used during initialisation.

Parameters:
cellsWide - Desired width of environment, in cells

setCellsHigh

public void setCellsHigh(int cellsHigh)
Adjusts the number of cell rows in the environment. All cells are deleted by this method and then recreated to the new specification. This loses agent data, and should ONLY be used during initialisation.

Parameters:
cellsHigh - Desired height of environment, in cells

setCellWidth

public void setCellWidth(int cellWidth)
Sets the width of all cells in the environment (each cell has the same width)

Parameters:
cellWidth - Desired width of cells in the environment, in pixels

setCellHeight

public void setCellHeight(int cellHeight)
Sets the height of all cells in the environment (each cell has the same height)

Parameters:
cellHeight - Desired height of the cells in the environment, in pixels
